main event: An unidentified aerial object was observed by an Army Colonel over Vaughn, New Mexico in November 1948.
interesting points: The object was described as being the size of a basketball with a diameter of approximately 1 foot., It was bright white in color and descended slowly before exploding without any sound., The incidents were reported on the 3rd or 4th of November and again on the 23rd of November 1948., No meteorological explanations were provided, leading to speculation about military exercises., The Colonel maintained that the object did not appear to be of natural origin, suggesting it could be man-made.
sighted object: a ball of light, reddish white in color, approximately 1 foot in diameter
